channel.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
channel.description:
Ok, heres my situation.
At my work, we have a few computers for sale. Now im not a seller, but i believe i can profit from these computers.
First Step, make the computers seem broken Logic being that anyone that knows what there doing can fuck up a computer in 10 seconds. These are computers for sale, and everything is unlocked...
Second Step, fix the computers after everyone sees how fucked they are
Third Step, make them a program that shows the specs of the computer, without anyone but workers able to close it. Thus, making the computer safe, or at least safer, from people trying to fuck it up.
so, how do i achieve step 1, to an extent that i can still reach step 2. how do i make a computer seem screwed, but so that i can still bring it back.

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @master_silabsoft master silabsoft
item.description:
@master_silabsoft wrote:

cool its 2009 and just hit it with a hammer or maybe an axe =)

Read full topic

you say most, is mine the exception to the rule

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah most of the suggestions so far would work. Are you working with the usual office-type people who haven’t got a clue how a computer works?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a computer seem broken?

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

you could try to disconnect the hard disks from their cables. And also slightly lift the video card from the socket.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a computer seem broken?

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

If you’re an administrator, program and install a service/daemon that consumes a fuckload of resources, making the computer so sluggish that no one is willing to use it.

Easy to remove too, and if you “get caught”, you can just say that it’s probably a virus and you have nothing to do with it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a computer seem broken?

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Jam the fan in the CPU with a cable or Toothpick it will beep instead of starting up

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a computer seem broken?

item.title: How to make a computer seem broken?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Pull the CPU fan so that it overheats very quickly (most mobos will shutdown immediately if it goes over the threshold)

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a computer seem broken?
